data.description: DarkBlue Intelligence Analyst Intern - Summer 2026Job Category: Intern/Co-opTime Type: Part timeMinimum Clearance Required to Start: NoneEmployee Type: Part-Time On-CallPercentage of Travel Required: NoneType of Travel: None* * *The Opportunity:Opportunity We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Intelligence Analyst intern to join our intelligence team. In this role, you will assist in data collection, quality assurance, and report generation focused on hard target OSINT collection from the Open, Deep and Dark Web. This is an excellent opportunity for university students to gain hands-on experience in intelligence analysis while supporting our DarkBlue Intelligence Suite customer engagement efforts. You will work alongside experienced analysts using the DarkBlue Intelligence Suite and learn how to transform complex data into actionable insights for current and prospective customersResponsibilities:Support data collection efforts across open-source intelligence platformsConduct quality assurance on gathered intelligence data to ensure accuracy and reliabilityAssist in preparing client-facing reports and marketing materials that showcase our capabilitiesHelp maintain and organize intelligence databasesCreate visualizations and summaries of analysis findings for various stakeholdersSupport senior analysts in research projects and client deliverablesDocument procedures and best practices for intelligence gathering techniquesQualifications:Required: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program in Intelligence Studies, International Relations, Political Science, Computer Science, or related fieldStrong interest in cybersecurity, intelligence analysis, or national securityExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAttention to detail and commitment to data accuracyBasic understanding of research methodologies and data collection techniquesProficiency with Microsoft Office suite (especially Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)Ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentMust be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the futureDesired:Prior coursework in intelligence analysis, cybersecurity, or data analyticsFamiliarity with basic data visualization toolsUnderstanding of OSINT principles and techniquesInterest in dark web research and emerging cyber threatsExperience with basic analytical tools and databases-________________________________________________________________________________________What You Can Expect: A culture of integrity.At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation. An environment of trust.CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality. A focus on continuous growth.Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy. Your potential is limitless. So is ours.Learn more about CACI here.________________________________________________________________________________________Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.Since this position can be worked in more than one location, the range shown is the national average for the position.The proposed salary range for this position is: $39,900-$79,900CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.
requirements: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program in Intelligence Studies, International Relations, Political Science, Computer Science, or related field
